Information: Annual average :math:`\text{CH}$_4$` (methane) emitted per ha of crop grown. **Rice** is the only crop that should be non-zero. This will be 0 for most crops (or negligible).
Notes: Applies to rice only. All other crops should be 0. See section 5.5 of the `IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories <https://www.ipcc.ch/report/2019-refinement-to-the-2006-ipcc-guidelines-for-national-greenhouse-gas-inventories/>`_

Information: Annual average :math:`\text{CO}$_2$` (carbon dioxide) emitted per metric ton of crop grown due to biomass  and dead organic matter. Driven by yield.
Notes: See sections 5.2.1 and 5.2.2 of the `IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories <https://www.ipcc.ch/report/2019-refinement-to-the-2006-ipcc-guidelines-for-national-greenhouse-gas-inventories/>`_

Information: Annual average :math:`\text{CO}$_2$` (carbon dioxide) emitted per ha of crop; for the purposes of accounting and calibration. Represents emissions from soil carbon, including tillage.
Notes: See section 5.2.3 of the `IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories <https://www.ipcc.ch/report/2019-refinement-to-the-2006-ipcc-guidelines-for-national-greenhouse-gas-inventories/>`_

Information: Annual average :math:`\text{N}$_2$\text{O}` (nitrous oxide) emitted per ha of crop grown due to biomass burning.
Notes: See section 5.2.4 of the `IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories <https://www.ipcc.ch/report/2019-refinement-to-the-2006-ipcc-guidelines-for-national-greenhouse-gas-inventories/>`_

Information: Elasticity of demand for crop in category ``$CAT-AGRICULTURE$`` to the changes in income, whose proxy is gdp/capita
Notes: See the `USDSA Commodity and Food Elasticities Database <https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/commodity-and-food-elasticities/>`_ for baseline elasticies by country.

Information: Proportion of the crop yield that is used for animal feed. Used to adjust demand for crops in response to changing animal populations. Demands for non-animal feed are driven by gdp/capita. Trivial proportions (e.g., radish tops) can be ignored.
Notes: Loose proportions dervied from `Statista <https://www.statista.com/statistics/1099196/brazil-corn-animal-feed/>`_ (quantity of Maize yield used for livestock feed), `FAO <https://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#data/QCL>`_ (total yield), and `VOX <https://www.vox.com/2014/8/21/6053187/cropland-map-food-fuel-animal-feed>`_ (conceptual importance).

Information: Yield (metric tons) per hectare of crops planted

Proportion of total **crop** area (%/100), where crop area is calculated as the product of the country's area (``area_country_ha``) and the fraction of land use that is devoted to crop land (``frac_lu_cropland``)
Primarily captures :math:`\text{CH}_4` emissions from rice paddies

Variable: Change to Net Imports of Crops
Information: Difference between crops demanded and those that can be produced locally. Assumption is that demand is met and they will be imported.
Proportion of cropland represented by each crop
